items.descriptor: Measure how effectively teams integrate customer feedback into the agile delivery process
items.raw: Customer-Centric Agility Measure how effectively teams integrate customer feedback into the agile delivery process

entries.descriptor: Customer input is not actively gathered or incorporated into development decisions.
Success is primarily measured by internal deliverables, not customer outcomes.
Some user feedback is collected, but it's infrequent or only considered post-release.
Teams occasionally reference personas or customer needs during planning.
Customer feedback influences backlog prioritization and product decisions.
Product teams use techniques like user interviews, surveys, or usability testing during development.
Features are designed to validate specific user behaviors or assumptions.
Customer success metrics (e.g., retention, satisfaction, task completion) drive product strategy.
Experiments and A/B tests are regularly used to optimize features based on real usage data.
Customer feedback loops are rapid, automated, and integral to the delivery process.

yesNoInProgress.meta-description: Three options to determine if an action is not started, in progress, or completed
